column1:
Sign from this field will be used as parser instruction for comparison.
If the selected sign is %, the minimum value of the top attribute will be calculated according to the formula: maxValue - x% * (maxValue - minValue).
In case the selected sign is % and attribute type is text, the minimum value of the top attribute will be calculated by the cron job at night.
column2:
Sign from this field will be used as parser instruction for comparison.
If the selected sign is %, the minimum value of the top attribute will be calculated according to the formula: maxValue - x% * (maxValue - minValue).
In case the selected sign is % and attribute type is text, the minimum value of the top attribute will be calculated by the cron job at night.

column1: [] equal to one of many values, separated by a comma
column2: [] equal to one of many values, separated by a comma

column1: % in top best x%, use for numeric values
column2: % in top best x%, use for numeric values

column1: Minimum value to show a Top Indicator. Value in this field is read only and will be calculated automatically in case of % sign chosen.
column2: Minimum value to show a Top Indicator. Value in this field is read only and will be calculated automatically in case of % sign chosen.

column1: You can get this product on %s (%s) if you buy it now!
column2: You can get this product on %s (%s) if you buy it now!

column1: Specify the time from which orders should be taken, in days. E.g. set 7 if you want use orders from last 7 days. Can be overwritten in the product.
column2: Specify the time from which orders should be taken, in days. E.g. set 7 if you want use orders from last 7 days. Can be overwritten in the product.

column1: Specify the minimal amount of orders to show Recently Bought badge. Can be overwritten in the product.
column2: Specify the minimal amount of orders to show Recently Bought badge. Can be overwritten in the product.

column1: Provide list of holidays, one date per line. Format: dd.mm.yyyy
column2: Provide list of holidays, one date per line. Format: dd.mm.yyyy

column1: Time to which the orders will be ship on the same day. E.g. 15:00
column2: Time to which the orders will be ship on the same day. E.g. 15:00

column1: Set how long logistics works per day (in hours). E.g. 10
column2: Set how long logistics works per day (in hours). E.g. 10

column1: Set how many hours is already reserved. E.g. 5
column2: Set how many hours is already reserved. E.g. 5

column1: Time to which the orders will be shipped on the same day. E.g. 15:00

column1: Show text note on product's detailpage
